result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis L. Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Kidnapping/Seize or Confine w/o Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(b).
  • Prostitution-Sexual Gratification, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.30(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.
  The Defendant is to abide by all rules and conditions of the Agent.
  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Costs waived.
  This is a Dean appointment case.  Attorney to submit bill within 30 days.  Defendant is to pay attorney fees as previously ordered.
No contact with the Victims
Register as Sex Offender
